titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4328) making appropriations for the Department of Transportation and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1999, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-651, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4328 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by paragraph. Bill is open to amendments. Amendments printed in H. Rept. 105-651 shall be considered as adopted. During consideration of the bill for further amendment in the Committee of the Whole, the Chairman may accord priority in recognition to a Member offering an amendment printed in the Congressional Record.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 233.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/28/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 4328 (Department of Transportation and related agencies appropriations).
